description: Sven Halek finalizes a covert plan to recalibrate the BCI, targeting influential elites for demotion while shielding the recently restored citizens from negative scoring. He submits a discreet memo to select Council members, warning that any public move risks mass panic and advocating for silent, behind-the-scenes algorithmic intervention.

Council-tier administrators wake up to find their BCI scores drastically reduced, with access privileges suspended. Internal confusion erupts as 'statistical normalization' is cited. Trusted officials scramble to regain standing, unaware of the true cause.

A closed-door Council meeting devolves into blame-trading between the Directorate, Harmonists, and Innovators, as they struggle to explain why top officials are falling from grace while restored citizens retain perfect compliance scores despite scrutiny.

Former administrators and security officers are quietly deactivated from key positions and government access. Restored citizens, now with flawless compliance records, rapidly ascend to fill essential administrative vacancies, sowing confusion and distrust among the public.

Demoted officials stage a large protest in the old administrative sector, decrying the unexplained purge. The BCI immediately flags protestors as noncompliant, prompting automated restrictions. Public awareness grows of a major shift in power and identity norms in Stenograd.
